description:
Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus is a action-stealth game set in a cartoony cel-shaded world.
Avenge your father and take back the pages of the Thievius Raccoonus from the Fiendish Five!
game: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus

v0.1.1-alpha.description:
Bugfixes to initial client release.

- Client should more consistently unlock your opening level
- Client no longer resets your progress in the opening level of each world on startup
- Memory leak issues should be fixed
v0.1.1-alpha.title: Alpha v0.1.1

v0.1.2-alpha.description: Fixed the way the apworld was zipped up
v0.1.2-alpha.title: Alpha v0.1.2

v0.1.3-alpha.description:
Expands on the existing options slightly.

- Adds an All option to Starting Episodes, immediately allowing access to all four starting levels.
- Adds the Avoid Early BK option, which immediately grants the player a key to their starting episode. (If All is selected, the key is granted to one level at random.)

v0.1.4-alpha.description:
Additions and fixes to both the AP world and client.

- The AP world now has logic acknowledging that sprints in opening levels cannot be completed until the hub has been opened, and that the starting level of Fire in the Sky cannot be completed without tier 1 invisibility.
- The AP world now includes an option to exclude certain minigame types.
- The client now has a basic GUI.
- The client will now automatically skip certain cutscenes.

v0.1.5-alpha.description:
Additions and bugfixes to the client and AP world.

* New items: Traps! If enabled, these may replace your filler items and alter the game in a variety of ways. Beware the dastardly Ball Trap... (NOTE: Ball Trap may behave unexpectedly if acquired while Sly is performing a thief move. Errors should be purely cosmetic, and can be fixed by leaving and reentering levels.)
* Client now has built-in functionality for the Bentley Skipper and FMV Skipper patches. Dialogue Skipper will be delayed due to issues with automatically skipping vault codes.
* Client should have better save-load functionality and require less resets. Disconnect button is now functional.
* AP world should now function properly when more than one person playing Sly is included.

v0.2.0-alpha.description:
Additions and bugfixes to the AP world and client.

- New feature: Cluesanity! Clue bottles can now be included as both items and locations, in bundles ranging from 1 to 5. (NOTE: Clue bottles as locations don't work entirely as intended as intended right now. This will be fixed in a future update. Bundle size of 1 is recommended for the time being.)
- Client is generally better about handling received items, especially when received offline.
- Client will attempt to wait for the player to be in control of Sly before activating traps. This isn't perfect, and will be improved in the future.
- Client has a prototype version of automatic cutscene skipping. Use of the cutscene skip PNACH is still recommended.
- All four bosses now have to be beaten properly before the final episode is unlocked, rather than solely needing to beat Panda King.
- Client will now print all messages that are relevant to you in the log. Functionality for sending messages like hints will be added next update.
- Client will now require the player to have loaded a save file, or beaten Paris on a new file, before processing items.
- General stability improvements thanks to the updated library.
v0.2.0-alpha.title: v0.2.0-alpha: Cluesanity

v0.2.1-alpha.description:
Bugfixes for cluesanity and other issues.

- Logic will now properly require the player to have all bottles for a level before hourglasses can be obtained.
- Client has been cleansed of evil swamp magic and will no longer lock the player out of Vicious Voodoo.
- The last six bottles in Flaming Temple of Flame can now be obtained.
- All bottles in Unseen Foe now require Progressive Invisibility logically.
- Generation will no longer fail if any players share a starting episode and any of them have Avoid Early BK enabled.
v0.2.1-alpha.title: v0.2.1-alpha

v0.2.2-alpha.description:
New option and minor bugfixes.

- New option, "Hourglasses Require Roll," which will logically require a Progressive Roll before hourglasses are considered. Also makes Progressive Rolls progression, rather than useful.
- Various other bugfixes to generation.
v0.2.2-alpha.title: v0.2.2-alpha

v0.2.3-alpha.description:
Adds new "Required Bosses" option.

- Can now set the amount of bosses required to access Cold Heart of Hate in your yaml.
- Progressive Roll will only be progressive if both hourglasses and require roll for hourglasses options are enabled.
v0.2.3-alpha.title: v0.2.3-alpha

v0.2.4-alpha.description:
Updates to cluesanity and world generation.

- Fixed generation error where starting episode(s) were being shuffled into the pool.
- Cluesanity locations will now be sent properly based on number of bottles player has collected.
- Paris Files will now be sent after the files have been collected from the safe, rather than after arriving at the hideout. The most important change.
v0.2.4-alpha.title: v0.2.4-alpha

v0.2.5-alpha.description:
A new option, one option split into two, and improved client QoL.

* Adds minigame caches as an option, allowing minigames to award up to 10 checks rather than the default 1.
* Decouples cluesanity, allowing items and locations to be set individually.
* Adds functionality for the client to modify in-game text to keep track of the player's collected worlds and bottles.
* Improvements to apworld rules and safeguards to ensure seeds won't generate with insufficient locations.
* Client will now attempt to bruteforce the game's anti-piracy measures, because they are really annoying.
v0.2.5-alpha.title: v0.2.5-alpha

v0.3.0-alpha.description:
Sly 1 Archipelago has received its biggest update yet, with a new client, new options, and more!

* The client has been rewritten from scratch to run natively in Archipelago through PINE. The standalone client is no longer required. The Sly 1 Client can be run through the Archipelago Launcher after installing the apworld.
* Due to this, PCSX2 1.6.0 is now deprecated. The client requires a version of PCSX2 that supports PINE (recommended: 2.2.0).
* The apworld now supports two new options:
* An alternate win condition: Page Hunt! The Fiendish Five have scattered pages of the Thievius Raccoonus across the multiworld, and Sly will need to collect them to challenge Clockwerk. Acts as a traditional MacGuffin hunt. Note that generation may fail if you don't have spare locations through cluesanity or minigame caches.
* A QoL option: Fast Clockwerk. Unlocks "A Strange Reunion" (the Clockwerk boss fight) on the map after CHoH is unlocked. Must be selected from the map after entering the first level.
* Text replacement is temporarily deprecated due to unforeseen difficulties. In its place, the client has two commands: `/vaults`, which prints the names of levels with openable vaults, and `/check_goal`, which will print your progress towards your goal.
* Various improvements to apworld logic.
* Bentley Jumpscare Trap has been temporarily disabled due to copyright concerns. It will be replaced by another trap in a future version.
v0.3.0-alpha.title: v0.3.0-alpha

v0.3.1-alpha.description:
Some new additions to the new client and apworld.

* Bentley Jumpscare Trap has been replaced by the Invisibility Trap. (NOTE: Currently a bit experimental. Does not hide the glow if Sly has a charm, due to difficulties in getting that to work without the game crashing.)
* Reimplemented text replacement; the game will now keep track of collected clue bottles if cluesanity is enabled, as well as which worlds are unlocked.
* Reimplemented measures to deal with Sly 1's surprisingly aggressive anticheat. Hopefully disabled the function that spawns an invisible firewall in Into the Machine.
* Implemented dialogue skipper pnach natively. You can now press R2 to skip lines of dialogue.
v0.3.1-alpha.title: v0.3.1-alpha

v0.3.2-alpha.description: Fixed a bug where possessing every thief move would cause vaults to be empty and not count as opened.
v0.3.2-alpha.title: v0.3.2-alpha

v0.3.3-alpha.description:
- Traps will no longer trigger in minigame levels, to prevent rare softlocks.
- The client should no longer throw endless errors if the item progress json becomes corrupted, such as through a PC crash.
- FMV cutscenes can now be skipped by pressing R2.
- Added a "Cutscene Skip" option to the yaml, enabled by default. If disabled, the client will no longer skip cutscenes automatically. Dialogue and FMVs can still be skipped by pressing R2.
- Adjusted functionality of minigame caches; the "[Minigame] Key" location will now be generated no matter what, unless the minigame type is excluded. Minigame caches will be added if the option is set above 0. This should fix any overlapping ID issues.
v0.3.3-alpha.title: v0.3.3-alpha
